page.title: 17 FARMING
page.content:
There are 8 farms marked on the map in our area and 3 to 4 farms outside but with land within. The largest farm is 460 acres and the smallest only 4 acres. All of the farms grow a grass for hay and silage.
One arable farm has all but 2 acres devoted to cereal crops. There is a lot of barley and oil seed rape grown in this area. There are only two purely stock farms, the two smallest, keeping ewes and cattle on an acreage of grassland.
Most farmers grow a mixture of wheat, barley, oil seed rape and fodder crops such as mangels and turnips, as well as having permanent pasture and sown grass.
